alert.note: Alert for Creek; Osage; Pawnee; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 2:38AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Osage, northeastern Creek, southeastern Pawnee and Tulsa Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 237 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Keystone State Park to 8 miles north of Bristow. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Owasso... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Catoosa... Mannford... Kiefer... Kellyville... Keystone State Park... Jenks Riverside Airport... Tulsa International Airport... Turley... Gray... Leonard... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 196 and 232. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
